definition: to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It is pointed out that the establishment of national environmental monitoring information system (NEMIS) is urgent and feasible.
sentences.chinese: 分析了建立国家环境监理信息系统的迫切性和可行性。

sentences.english: And without statistics, there's no urgency to change, Silverstein said.
sentences.chinese: 而没有统计，就失去了改变的迫切性，西尔弗斯坦说。

sentences.english: Objective\ To evaluate the prevalence of malocclusion and orthodontic treatment priority in adolescent.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究青少年错畸形的严重程度和治疗的迫切性。

sentences.english: Whence the urgency that the sense of this word be discernible.
sentences.chinese: 这个文字的意义应该被辨明的迫切性，从何而来？

sentences.english: The loss of the civilization feeling of contemporary people makes the feeling education come into emergency trend.
sentences.chinese: 当代人文明情感的缺失，使情感教育呈迫切性的趋势。
一些国家明白事情的迫切性。

sentences.english: The world economy must decarbonise more urgently than carbon markets anticipate.
sentences.chinese: 世界经济急需减排，其迫切性远超碳市场的期望。

definition: to attach importance to sth/to value
